posts.author: RogueReroll
posts.content:
I've been thinking about Sorcerer lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about Sorcerer that came up in our game last night.

I'd love to hear everyone's experiences with Sorcerer and how it's worked in your games.

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about Sorcerer?

posts.author: BardTales
posts.content:
I think the 2024 changes to discussion make it much more balanced compared to before.

Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that discussion functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

I've been playing a Gnome Rogue in my campaign, and I've noticed that discussion really impacts how effective the character is in combat.

posts.author: RangerDanger
posts.content:

posts.author: HomebrewHero
posts.content:
The best campaign moment I ever had involved creative use of discussion to solve what seemed like an impossible puzzle.

The way I understand the rules for discussion, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.

In the new 2024 rules update, they changed how discussion works. Now it's more streamlined but I'm not sure if it's better overall.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about discussion. Based on my experience, it works differently.
